author: Morgan Housel
summary: A summary of actionable financial principles: find humility, save without a specific goal, manage money to sleep at night, increase your time horizon, become OK with things going wrong, use money for time control, and respect the mess of personal finance.
key_takeaways: Manage your money in a way that helps you sleep at night.
Increase your time horizon - time is the most powerful force in investing.
Use money to gain control over your time - the highest dividend in finance.

questions.question: What is the best universal guidepost for all financial decisions?

options.text: Maximize investment returns at all costs
Does this help me sleep at night?
Follow what successful investors are doing

questions.explanation: Manage your money in a way that helps you sleep at night. Some won't sleep unless earning highest returns; others need conservative investments. The foundation of 'does this help me sleep at night?' is the best universal guidepost.

questions.question: What is the single most powerful thing you can do to become a better investor?
questions.explanation: Time is the most powerful force in investing. It makes little things grow big and big mistakes fade away. It can't neutralize luck and risk, but it pushes results closer towards what people deserve.

questions.question: Why should you be comfortable with a lot of your investments not working out?

options.text: Because a small minority of things account for the majority of outcomes

questions.explanation: You can be wrong half the time and still make a fortune because a small minority of things account for the majority of outcomes. Judge yourself by your full portfolio, not individual investments.
